remarks: The Alexander Subbase Theorem: a space is compact iff it has a subbase such that any cover taken from the subbase has a finite subcover. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 24-Jan-2010.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.)  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
alexsubALT.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
alexsubALT $p |- ( J e. Comp <-> E. x ( J = ( topGen ` ( fi ` x ) ) /\ A. c e. ~P x ( X = U. c -> E. d e. ( ~P c i^i Fin ) X = U. d ) ) ) $.
$d J c d x $.
$d X c d x $.
